title: How did the idea of the 'Five Civilized Tribes' come about? - Quora

response.answer_text: Howdy, The Six Nations were considered wild Indians, yet they lived in long houses (apartments), tended fields, stored food…owned slaves. The Five Civilized Tribes…Chickasaw, Choctaw, Creek, Cherokee, Seminole…lived in houses before the whites came to Georgia…they built log cabins, adopted white dress, traded with whites owned black slaves. Now; Before whites arrived the Creek raised cotton weaving fine cloth for clothing. Creek/Chickasaw towns consisted of square/oblong houses, large towns…huge fields of corn, beans, squash other vegetables. They had Identities, governments, trading networks, a Confederacy of Tribes/Peoples…the Chickasaw pulled out as the official language was Coweta Creek. The Seminole fought the US Army to a stand still…many never surrendered. The Federal Government refused to recognize the Seminole in Florida until they changed their name from Maia to Seminole.
